title: BBC Local Live: Northamptonshire for Tuesday 18 August 2015 - BBC News
summary: police officers could be forced to apologise in person if they carry out `` unreasonable searches '' on people in the street .
northants are out of the one day cup after their game against yorkshire is rained off .
mp tom pursglove is campaigning to keep corby and kettering magistrates ' court open .
more news , sport , weather and travel for northamptonshire from 08:00 on wednesday .

documents.title: good evening
text: thanks for joining us today .
we 'll be back tomorrow from 08:00 with all the latest news , sport , weather and travel .
the big news today has been northamptonshire police 's decision to hold a review into
author: Craig Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: northants wash out silver lining
text: northants ' exit from the one day cup may have a lucky omen silver lining .
the county side were knocked out after being
coach david ripley said : `` at least we have got the t20 finals day to look forward to .
we may go into them as underdogs again but we do n't mind the tag , just as we did n't ( when we won it ) two years ago . ''
author: Craig Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: northants wash out exit 'tough '
text: northamptonshire coach david ripley has been reacting to his side 's
he said : `` we would have gone into the match having won our last three fixtures in the competition which suggests that we are playing good cricket at the right time .
`` the forecast was pretty grim from the start of the day and it proved to be right , although going out without playing still feels tough . ''
author: BBC Sport

text: a review of northamptonshire police 's
duwayne brooks was later
he said : `` when officers misuse their stop and search powers they are chipping away at the confidence the public have in the police . ''
author: Craig Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : mainly dry with clearer skies
text: rain will slowly ease away to leave much of the night dry with clearer skies .
winds will ease slightly and temperatures by dawn will be around 14c ( 57f ) .
tomorrow will be a much better day with some good spells of sunshine , especially in the morning .
cloud will increase in the afternoon with some rain moving eastwards by the evening .
highs tomorrow of 21c ( 70f ) with a freshening south westerly wind .
author: Alina Jenkins
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: nominations open for sport awards
text: do you know a sporting hero in the daventry area ?
the 13th annual daventry district sports awards are looking for nominations .
club members , volunteers , individual athletes and supporters are encouraged to nominate individuals and teams for their achievements over the last year .
the winners will be announced at a formal evening celebration on 22 october .
you have until 18 september to nominate someone , which
author: Martin Borley
BBC Northampton

text: here are a few more details about the police and crime commissioner 's
a community panel has been
the panel consists of senior officers and members of the public .
it will also have the authority to ban officers that continued to search without good cause .
author: Martin Borley
BBC Northampton

documents.title: rain defeats northants
text: rain has
steady drizzle throughout the afternoon at headingley ruined any chance of play with the steelbacks needing victory to qualify .
they take just one point from this game meaning they are knocked out on net run-rate - a repeat of 2013 .
author: Alex Winter
BBC Radio Northampton sport

a

author: Martin Borley
BBC Northampton

text: volunteers are brightening up a daventry underpass this afternoon .
the community street art project involves colourful murals being added to the yeomanry way underpass on the grange estate .
the makeover continues until 17:00 and involves young people and staff from the

documents.title: fire at farm : police launch appeal
text: police are appealing for witnesses to a barn fire at a farm on chase park road near yardley hastings .
it happened sometime between 16:00 and 16:30 on saturday .
the cause of the fire is being investigated .
police are also giving farmers advice about
author: Martin Borley
BBC Northampton

documents.title: stone laid for new hq
text: a commemorative stone was laid earlier at the site of northamptonshire county council 's new £ 53m headquarters .
the authority is building a new base for 2,000 staff on angel street in northampton , where a car park used to be .
john marston , from the contractor galliford try , told me he is `` massively confident '' the building will be completed by october 2016 as planned .
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: overstone primary to expand
text: a statutory notice to double the number of pupils at overstone primary school has been published by the county council .
the local authority wants the school to take 210 children .
there would be an increase from 15 to 30 children per year group , phased in from september 2017 .
the publication of a statutory notice is the start of a four-week consultation period .
author: Martin Borley
BBC Northampton

documents.title: £ 300,000 refit for gyms
text: wellingborough 's two council-owned gyms are to be refitted as part of a new leisure centre deal .
the £ 300,000 improvements will start next week at
the borough council says it 's possible because of a new contract with the operator of the leisure centres , places for people .
author: Martin Borley
BBC Northampton

documents.title: in the news this lunchtime
text: the stories we 're talking about

BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: 'good progress ' on council hq
text: the leader of northamptonshire county council says it 's `` really good '' to see progress on the authority 's new headquarters .
the local authority is going to shut 12 offices when the new building in northampton 's derngate area opens in october 2016 .
contractors say the project is on time and on budget .
a commemorative stone was laid earlier .

conservative councillor jim harker said : `` it 's really good to see it so busy , but there 's not very much to see for the £ 10m that 's already been spent on the substructure , underground car park and piling . ''
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: travel delays continue on m1
text: delays are
one lane is closed and traffic is queuing for a mile before j15 ( the a45 northampton turn-off ) .
there has been a fuel spillage and recovery work is taking place .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: magistrates fight for 'local justice '
text: the chairman of the corby bench of magistrates , terry knight jp , says they need to `` save local justice '' for the benefit of residents .
he made his comments to the conservative mp for corby ,
mr knight said : `` there will be two tiers of justice : one for large cities , where public transport is frequent and relatively low cost , and another for rural areas . ''
author: Martin Borley
BBC Northampton

documents.title: knights a celebration of the town
text: here 's another of northampton 's

northampton borough council 's cabinet member for heritage , councillor tim hadland , said : `` the battle of northampton was fought in the grounds of delapre abbey in 1460 and in its heyday the castle was one of the most famous in england . ''
author: Martin Borley
BBC Northampton

documents.title: rushden 's splash pool closed
text: the splash leisure pool in rushden has been closed due to a serious technical issue .
the operator of the poll , aspirations wellbeing , has put on its
author: Martin Borley
BBC Northampton

documents.title: mp meets magistrates to discuss closure
text: corby mp tom pursglove has met with magistrates from the town to discuss the proposed closure of the court .
the ministry of justice is consulting on the closure of 91 courts in england and wales , including those in corby and kettering .

the conservative mp said : `` i very much see the need for justice to be dispensed as locally as possible , and it is crucial that people are able to access court proceedings - victims , perpetrators , those giving evidence , and members of the public . ''
author: Martin Borley
BBC Northampton

documents.title: travel : delays on m1
text: it 's because of an accident and a fuel spillage .

over the last year , the number of people being stopped and searched in the county has halved , but some campaigners claim young , black men are still being unfairly targeted by the police .

documents.title: knights on the move
text: six big medieval knight sculptures which have been
they were carved out of tree trunks by chainsaw artists daniel cordell , simon o'rourke and harry thomas .

the two 15th century knights will move to the grounds of delapre abbey and the four 13th and 14th century knights and a sculpture of the town crest will go to the castle site , near to the railway station .
author: Martin Borley
BBC Northampton

documents.title: punch & judy in landlocked northants
text: a punch and judy enthusiast from irthlingborough says being in a landlocked county does n't diminish the appeal of the traditional seaside show .
peter barratt , who has performed punch and judy for two years , puts on shows in schools and at summer fetes .
he says he loved the puppet show as a child : `` the attraction was the joining in , the storylines which were quite familiar with grumpy mr punch and the crocodile appearing half-way through .
they were fantastic memories '' .
author: Tom Percival
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: 'exceptional ' bowlers earn northants win
text: northants ' batsman josh cobb has praised his team 's bowlers after yesterday 's
he 's told bbc radio northampton : `` we bowled very well up front .
our bowlers are exceptional and really set up the game for the batters . ''
cobb struck 58 from 83 balls including eight fours as they reached their 215 run target .
northamptonshire face yorkshire at headingley today .
author: Martin Borley
BBC Northampton

the county
northamptonshire will reach the last eight of the one-day cup if they beat yorkshire at headingley today .
